author_bibliography.author: Author Name
author_bibliography.description: Description of the author and bibliography

early_period.characteristics: Early writings focus on the individual's subjective experience, irony, and critique of Hegelianism. Kierkegaard uses pseudonyms to explore multiple perspectives.
early_period.themes: Irony, aesthetic vs. ethical life, despair, faith, individuality, love, anxiety.

middle_period.characteristics: Heightened religious emphasis, increasingly critical of institutional Christianity. Kierkegaard continues to use pseudonyms while deepening theological reflection.
middle_period.themes: Sin, despair, faith, selfhood, human freedom, God-relation, paradox of Christianity.

late_period.characteristics: Direct religious writings and polemics. Open attacks on the Danish State Church and a call to authentic Christianity.
late_period.themes: Radical Christian discipleship, offense of the Incarnation, imitation of Christ, critique of Christendom, truth as subjectivity.

author_bibliography.influence: Influence of the author on other philosophers and thinkers
